thread.title: Apple Music launches, will cost NZ$12.99 per month
thread.title_full: Apple Music launches, will cost NZ$12.99 per month

title: Apple Music launches, will cost NZ$12.99 per month
text:
Apple Music launches, will cost NZ$12.99 per month 
  11:41 a.m. 
Apple's new streaming service has gone live and a subscription will cost Kiwis $12.99 per month. 
The service boasts access to millions of songs and offers recommendations from music curators. 
"We are profoundly passionate about music. It's a force that's driven and inspired us from day one. So we've set out to make it better," says a statement on the Apple Music website. 
"[The service hopes to] deepen the connection between artists and fans. To re-imagine radio with a 24/7, global station. This is Apple Music. And it's just the beginning." 
Apple Music went live at 3am New Zealand time, simultaneously launching Zane Lowe's Beats 1 radio. 
Lowe, the New Zealand-born DJ who became famous at BBC's Radio 1, launched the station with 'City' by Manchester indie pop-punk band Spring King. 
"It's not about fanfare. It's about quality and consistency. We're Beats 1, we're worldwide, and from now on, we're always on," Lowe said. 
After a three month free trial period, Apple Music customers in New Zealand will be charged $12.99 per month for a single user, or NZ$19.99 for a 'family package' of up to six devices. 
More information is available on the Apple Music NZ website . 
3 News
